messages.content: What is the main feature of ComfyUI-SaveAsScript (SaS)?
The main feature of SaS is that it provides a more robust command-line interface and the ability to export your current workflow as a script directly from a button on the ComfyUI web interface.
How can the output of a script file be modified in SaS?

SaS allows the user to specify an `--output` option that can override the default path of `SaveImage` nodes. Additionally, if `-` is selected as the output path, the resultant image will be piped to stdout.
Can scripts generated by SaS be imported as modules?
Yes, scripts generated by SaS can be imported as modules. They can be imported using an `import` statement in Python, and then the `main()` function can be used to call the workflow programmatically.
How can command-line arguments be passed to a script generated by SaS?

SaS automatically converts any required input variable left unfilled in the ComfyUI workflow into an argument. These arguments can be passed as command-line arguments when running the generated script.
Can the ComfyUI server be controlled via arguments?
Yes, if you want to pass anything to the ComfyUI server as an argument, you can use `--` to indicate you're done with SaS arguments and are now passing ComfyUI arguments.
What changes were introduced in ComfyUI-SaveAsScript compared to ComfyUI-To-Python-Extension?

ComfyUI-SaveAsScript introduced new features such as Module Support, Custom Output Path, and the ability to pass command-line arguments. Bugfixes for Windows paths and certain Crystools nodes were made, and improvements in compatibility with module API are planned.
What are potential use cases for ComfyUI-SaveAsScript?

Potential use cases for ComfyUI-SaveAsScript include streamlining the process for creating a lean app or pipeline deployment, creating programmatic experiments, generating large queues for image generation, and easily expanding or iterating on an architecture.
What version of ComfyUI-SaveAsScript has introduced support for custom nodes?
ComfyUI-SaveAsScript V1.0.0 has introduced support for custom nodes.
What is the procedure to use the SaS custom node?

The user needs to install the custom_node (via git cloning or the Manager), click the button in the web UI or run the CLI, move the created .py file to the `ComfyUI` folder, and run the generated script.
